intro: Drimyspermum billardieri, commonly known as the Chilean mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of native trees such as the *Nothofagus* species. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces white or pinkish flowers that are often clustered together. Its berries are red or black and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the health of its host trees if left unchecked.
